repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Third Electric
            Power Reconstruction Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Electric Power
            Reconstruction Project for Bosnia and Herzegovina were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was moderate, Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: 1) need for high quality feasibility
            studies for preparation of investments within an overall
            plan that is agreed by the stakeholders, and a transparent
            criteria for selection of schemes; 2) sector reforms and
            restructuring should be based on high quality analytical
            work, meaningful consultation and participation of
            stakeholders, and should be backed by political commitment;
            3) design of sector restructuring and the pace of its
            implementation should be owned and endorsed by the major
            stakeholders; and 4) the success of Financial Management
            Information System (FMIS) indicates that pilots for
            demonstration, and familiarization of the staff with new
            technologies, should be carried out before introducing a
            major change in business processes and sophisticated
            information technology (IT) tools.

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Third Electric
            Power Reconstruction Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project development objective of the
            Third Electric Power Reconstruction Project for
            Bosnia-Herzegovina is to continue the post-conflict
            reconstructtion program in the power sector and to ensure
            acess to reliable, lower cost electricity, to be supplied
            with reduced environmental and safety risks, and improved
            cost recovery by suppliers. There are seven project
            components. The first rehabilitates high voltage
            transmission network lines started under the Second Electric
            Power Reconstruction Project (report no. 20167). The second
            component finances reconstruction of key transmission
            substations. The third component establishes a supervisory
            control and data acquisition system and associated
            telecommunications facilities. The fourth component funds
            investments at hydropower stations to improve safety and
            availabilty. The fifth component makes investments in
            thermal power stations to control pollution. The sixth
            component supports distribution substation investments
            focusing on areas identified for refugee return, heavily
            damaged and cut-off areas which have little or no
            electricity supply, areas with war damage where many
            connections are of a temporary nature and power supply is
            unreliable and unsafe, and areas with seriously overloaded
            networks, due to refugee resettlement. The seventh component
            provides technical assistance and training in support of
            procurement and implementation of the physical components,
            among other sub-components.

docna.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Third Electric

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Third Electric
            Power Reconstruction Project : environmental management plans

abstracts.cdata!:
The environmental assessment examines
            the potential adverse effect on the environment, resulting
            from the implementation of the Third Electric Power Project.
            Water, air, and noise pollution will occur, as a result of
            electrostatic dust discharges, gas emissions, oil leakage,
            and vibration disturbances during construction. Mitigating
            measures include: 1) the construction of oil pits, and use
            of oil transformers, - toxic-free - to control oil spillage;
            2) the use of protective, noise abatement devices by
            construction workers, as well as setting time limits on
            working schedules, based on common day-time working hours.
            Additionally, noise measuring instruments should be
            provided; 3) controlled deforestation practices, in
            accordance with the country's laws, and regulations, to
            be followed by afforestation practices; 4) access
            interception to areas close to transmission lines, to avoid
            potential electro magnetic radiation effects; and, 5)
            regulation enforcement regarding sludge collection, for
            disposal into waste water treatment plants.

Bosnia and Herzegovina - Third Electric
            Power Reconstruction Project : environmental management plans
